content.user_title: Create specialized subagents for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Users need guidance on creating and configuring specialized AI assistants that can handle complex tasks. This skill provides templates, best practices, and step-by-step instructions for building effective subagents.
actual_capabilities: Define file-based agents with YAML frontmatter configuration
Dispatch on-demand subagents using the Task tool
Configure agent tools, models, and permission modes
Create reusable agent templates for common workflows
Set up automatic agent invocation with trigger phrases
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files automatically
Requires manual creation of agent files in correct locations
Does not integrate with external services or APIs

prompt_templates.title: Custom Agent Persona

prompt_templates.title: Parallel Execution

best_practices: Use the principle of least privilege when defining agent tools - only grant access to tools the agent truly needs
Include specific trigger conditions with PROACTIVELY in descriptions for automatic invocation
Structure agent prompts with role, constraints, workflow, and output format sections for clarity
anti_patterns: Granting all tools to every agent creates unnecessary security risk
Vague descriptions without trigger conditions prevent automatic invocation
Overly long prompts without structure confuse agent behavior

faq.question: What is the difference between file-based agents and Task tool dispatch?
faq.answer: File-based agents persist across sessions and can be shared via version control. Task tool dispatch creates on-demand agents for one-off or dynamic workflows.

faq.question: Where should I store project agents vs user agents?
faq.answer: Project agents go in .claude/agents/ within the project. User agents go in ~/.claude/agents/ for all projects.

faq.question: How do I choose the right model for my agent?
faq.answer: Use haiku for simple tasks, sonnet for most development work, and opus for complex reasoning requiring deep analysis.

faq.question: Is my data safe with subagents?
faq.answer: Yes. Agents run within the same secure environment. You control tools and permissions for each agent.

faq.question: Why is my agent not being invoked automatically?
faq.answer: Check that the description includes PROACTIVELY and clear trigger conditions. Verify the file is in the correct location with valid frontmatter.

faq.question: How do subagents compare to skills?
faq.answer: Subagents have isolated context windows and can have different tool permissions. Skills extend knowledge without isolation.
